data.title: Friendly coffee shop
data.text: Stopped in for coffee. The staff was very friendly and offered a couple samples of the higher priced coffee for us as we asked a bunch of questions regarding the different types of coffee beans they offered. Very pricy but if you love coffee you would love it.

data.title: Seattle Snob says Experience the Farm to Cup Coffee Plant !
data.text:
Everything in Seattle is better, our football team, our baseball team - well, maybe not.  Seattle is coffee culture central cause it rains all the time.  It was raining in Detroit today so I needed to find a decent cup of coffee.  I did some homework and the Roasting Plant look worth a shot.  

As I was walking in a guy was walking out with the creamy frothy cup of coffee.  I asked "What is that"  He said it was the Bali Blue Moon, straight no cream or sugar.  
I'm like I got to try that.  It was awesome.  Farm to Cup, in-house roasting.  I'm in!

data.title: A fascinating place to visit for coffee
data.text:
Here is the deal:
You order coffee, picking the beans
They use tubes to fly beans to the front
The beans are custom ground
The beans are custom brewed
You get 100% custom cup of coffee

This is a must visit if you're in downtown Detroit. Just watching the beans fly through all the tubes is reason enough to go. I'm not even a big coffee person, but I love everything about the Roasting Plant

data.title: Superb coffee
data.text: Some of the best coffee in the U.S. and reasonably priced.  If you love coffee, you will love this place and the selection of unique beans to choose from.

data.title: The Best Coffee EVER!
data.text:
This is not your typical trendy coffeehouse. This place is an experience. This coffee is outstanding. Can't express enough, this is good stuff. The staff is always pleasant. In the heart of Downtown Detroit.
I walk there every morning rain or shine.

data.title: Excellent coffee
data.text: I am not dinging them in the review, for it, but when they roast their beans, the smell is sometimes like burnt coffee.  But, they have excellent coffee and great and fast staff.

data.title: Unique
data.text:
The coffee is really very nice!
What makes this coffee bar even more special is the installation that holds the unroasted beans, the glass-steel roaster and the bean delivery systems of pipes and distributors.
It must be designed by a Chemical Process Engineer.
Friendly staff as well.
I will return !

data.title: Thought the one in Greenwich Village NYC was a knockoff.
data.text: It's not.  Same folks.  Same sleek look. Great tasting coffee.  My fiancé is a Detroit native so we make a point of visiting Roasting Plant whenever we're back in his hometown. Now that I know the NYC location is the flagship, I'll stop in when I'm in my hometown.

data.title: Coffee Engineering
data.text:
A colleague pointed this place out to us. It is fascinating to see how the beans are sucked through the pipes into the machine to make your brew.
Definitely, good coffees!

data.title: interesting, kind of quick, great selection
data.text: This is an interesting little coffee shop.  Select your coffee, the beans get suctioned in, roasted, ground and in your cup. The process is slightly longer than your normal routine, but a very fresh cup of java was well worth it.  There are maybe 10 different bean varieties to pick from(location-jamaica blue mt., cost rica, etc.). The coffee bar area was well stocked and clean.  The site could have used a a few more chairs for seating.  We would not miss this and do not be intimidated if you don't know coffee.  The staff was great about the entire process.  ENJOY!

data.title: Extraordinary Coffee
data.text: Best coffee I ever had and I am a snob.  Art meet science in this cafe, which results in a unique coffee experience.

data.title: LuigiSLP
data.text: coffee roasting at it's finest.. elaborate roasting plant that is worth the look see.  a phenomenal variety of coffee bean choices awaiting your pick ...

data.title: Coffee, yeah!
data.text: Highly recommended coffee place with world wide variety. Choose what you like most and see the coffee beans going through the pipes...

data.title: The beans go flying
data.text: I loved this little coffee shop. I ordered a honey roasted Costa Rican coffee because I was missing the flavor of some coffee I purchased when I was visiting Costa Rica last year. It tasted exactly the same! I was really impressed.

data.title: Great coffee!
data.text: Great coffee (and what a choice) on a nice location downtown Detroit. Choose your beans and it will be prepared right away!

data.title: Great coffee, excellent staff!
data.text: This was my first time visiting the Roasting Plant and the staff was very helpful in explaining the process of the Javabot and finding the right blend to satisfy my caffeine fix. We purchased the Brazilian roast coffee and the Green Matcha shake, since it was quite warm outside. Both were very good and the experience made it even better! Definitely will be visiting again!

data.title: Loving this place...
data.text:
I am a Detroit native, though I don't live in the city right now. One of the gems of places fairly new to the downtown area is Roasting Plant. Great coffee and really cool swanky atmosphere. You feel like you get cool points for just walking in the joint--if you're into that kinda thing...

Say you're just into really good, uniquely flavored, well presented coffee from a place--the Roasting Plant wins. So much so that I drive a considerable distance to meet my favorite coffee companions here, or to grab a cup an take it out (I usually prefer to grind and brew at home). This is the place where coffee connoisseurs can come, enjoy, and not feel duped or sugared for their spend.

All I have left to say is: Ethiopian Harrar Bedessa and that my next step is buying beans to take home. Please try and enjoy.

data.title: Best cappuccino in Detroit
data.text: Bold claim but this traveller believes the best cappuccino in Detroit is at the Roasting Planting on Campus Martius. Use their Javabot technology to put together the perfect blend of the coffee for your tastes. Give it a try!

data.title: Great coffee and a show
data.text:
It might be a gimmick to see your coffee beans fly through the air before being freshly ground but there's nothing like a fresh ground cup of coffee any time of the day. I did enjoy the variety of coffee beans to choose from and they were so much quicker than a large coffee chain in the area. 

Give them a try for a great cup of coffee and support a local merchant at the same time!

data.title: Unique!  An attraction
data.text: A coffee-lover's dream.  From the beans themselves, to the delivery method, to the care taken with each cup, to the available variety.  Never seen anything like this place...  Very cool!  And a decent value to boot....
